wiki.summary: In the 13th track on their 2020 album Savage Mode II, 21 Savage and Metro Boomin speak about their policy when dealing with enemies. 21 Savage starts the song by describing his unfortunate upbringing, which he then turns into a verse about his luxurious life in the present-day. 21 continues with this theme throughout the song, and uses the main chorus to explain how he’s needed to show no mercy to his opposition to get where he is today. wiki.content: In the 13th track on their 2020 album Savage Mode II, 21 Savage and Metro Boomin speak about their policy when dealing with enemies. 21 Savage starts the song by describing his unfortunate upbringing, which he then turns into a verse about his luxurious life in the present-day. 21 continues with this theme throughout the song, and uses the main chorus to explain how he’s needed to show no mercy to his opposition to get where he is today. At the end of the song, actor Morgan Freeman’s vocals reinforce the idea that 21 Savage seeks to rid himself of his opposition. Freeman explains to the listener that being surrounded with numerous enemies is detrimental to one’s life and progression, so it is essential for individual success that everyone follows 21’s example of eliminating all of your enemies. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
